column2: DELAWARE DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.

column2: 2. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column8: A steep grade is ahead

column2: 4. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the right lane.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: Work work ahead

column2: 6. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 7. Regulatory signs are:
column8: yellow.

column2: 8. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 9. A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You must:
column4: reduce your speed, change lanes and pass.
column6: stop until all the children have left the bus.
column8: stop until the lights stop flashing.

column2: 10. Before entering a curve, you should:
column8: pump your brakes several times.

column2: 11. When driving at night, if an approaching car is using its high-beams you should:
column4: turn your lights on and off.
column6: look toward the right edge of the road.
column8: look toward the left edge of the road.

column2: 12. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 13. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn

column2: 15. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column4: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.
column6: yield to the vehicles on your left only.
column8: slow down and proceed.

column2: 16. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column8: stop much more slowly

column2: 17. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column6: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed
column8: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 19. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 20. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: less dangerous

column2: 21. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column4: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.
column8: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.

column2: 22. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. When driving in foggy weather, drivers should:
column4: put their lights on high beam.
column8: put their lights on low beam.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column8: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 26. To keep the driver behind you at a safe distance you should:
column4: drive 5 MPH slower than the car behind.
column8: drive 5 MPH faster than the car behind.

column2: 27. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 28. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.
column6: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 29. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: On the right curb.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.
